results:
Based on the search results, I found some information about theatrical adaptations of "Jane Eyre" in Polish theaters, though the specific production you're looking for at Teatr Polski with the title "Dziwne losy" appears to have limited information available.

Here's what I found:

## Radio Theater Adaptation

There was a radio theater production titled "Dziwne losy Jane Eyre (odcinek 1)" at Teatr Polskiego Radia, which premiered on April 10, 1989. However, the search results incorrectly attribute the authorship to Emily Brontë, when "Jane Eyre" was actually written by Charlotte Brontë.

## National Theatre Live Production

The British National Theatre prepared a stage adaptation of "Jane Eyre" as part of their National Theatre Live project, which was shown in selected Polish cinemas on December 8, 2015. The production was directed by Sally Cookson and adapted for the National Theatre stage.

The live transmission from London was scheduled for December 8, 2015, and could be seen in only three locations in Poland on the premiere day: Praha Cinema and Atlantic Cinema in Warsaw, and Nowe Horyzonty in Wrocław. The performance lasted about 210 minutes and was shown in the original language version with Polish subtitles.

## About the Novel

"Dziwne losy Jane Eyre" is a novel written by Charlotte Brontë that was first published in October 1847 in three volumes and became a great publishing success. The story of Jane Eyre has received numerous film adaptations as well as many translations into different languages.

Unfortunately, I couldn't find specific information about a production titled "Dziwne losy" as a theatrical adaptation at Teatr Polski. The search results mainly provide information about the novel itself, its Polish translations, and the National Theatre Live screening in Polish cinemas.
